questions.clue: In L. Frank Baum's famous book, Dorothy travels to this colorful land over the rainbow.
This 'Great' novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald is set in the fictional West Egg and East Egg on Long Island.
Narnia, the setting for C.S. Lewis's series, is accessed through a wardrobe in this first published book.
questions.answer: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe

questions.clue: Set in the fictional Republic of Gilead, this dystopian novel by Margaret Atwood explores themes of oppression and control.
Chingiz Abdullayev, an author from this country, is known for setting his detective novels in the complex landscapes of Azerbaijan.
This Azerbaijani city, known for its Flame Towers, is the capital and largest city of the country.
In 1991, Azerbaijan gained independence from this former union.
Azerbaijan shares a border with this country known for its biblical history and significant Jewish population.
This ancient Zoroastrian temple near Baku, known for its eternal flame, is a popular tourist attraction.
This epic book of Azerbaijani literature, often compared to the works of Homer, tells the story of a hero fighting for justice.
This Israeli app helps drivers navigate traffic by providing real-time updates and has been acquired by Google.
Developed in Israel, this medical device allows patients with heart failure to live longer, healthier lives.
This Israeli defense system, named after a biblical weapon, intercepts incoming missiles with high accuracy.
This Israeli-founded company is behind the USB flash drive, revolutionizing data storage worldwide.
Known for its book-like display, this Israeli technology underpins many popular e-readers sold globally.
This Greek hero, known for his strength, completed 12 labors including slaying the Nemean Lion.
In Norse mythology, this hammer-wielding god is associated with thunder and lightning.
In Azerbaijani mythology, this dragon-like creature is often depicted as a guardian of treasures and is called 'Ejderha'.
According to Jewish folklore, this mythical creature is created from clay and brought to life to serve its creator.
This ancient Mesopotamian epic, one of the earliest works of literature, features the hero's quest for immortality and includes a great flood story.
For 200: This scientist is famous for his laws of motion and universal gravitation.
For 400: Known as the father of modern physics, he developed the theory of relativity.
For 600: This Polish-born scientist was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and remains the only person to win Nobel Prizes in two different sciences.
For 800: This Azerbaijani scientist is known for his contributions to petroleum chemistry and played a significant role in the development of the oil industry in Azerbaijan.
For 1000: An Israeli chemist, he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 2004 for his discovery of ubiquitin-mediated protein degradation.

final.clue: This 12th-century epic poem, which shares a name with a city in Azerbaijan, is one of the most celebrated works of Persian literature and was translated into Hebrew in the 19th century.
